questions.questionText: Which of these best describes an array?

options.text: A data structure that shows a hierarchical behavior
Container of objects of similar types
Array is not a data structure

questions.explanation: Array contains elements only of the same type.

questions.questionText: How do you initialize an array in C?
questions.explanation: This is the syntax to initialize an array in C.

questions.questionText: How do you instantiate an array in Java?
questions.explanation: Note that int arr[]; is declaration whereas int arr[] = new int[3]; is to instantiate an array.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is the correct way to declare a multidimensional array in Java?
questions.explanation: The syntax to declare multidimensional array in java is either int[][] arr; or int arr[][];
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is a run-time exception and the compilation is error-free.

questions.questionText: Which of the following concepts make extensive use of arrays?
questions.explanation: Whenever a particular memory location is referred to, it is likely that the locations nearby are also referred, arrays are stored as contiguous blocks in memory, so if you want to access array elements, spatial locality makes it to access quickly.

questions.questionText: What are the advantages of arrays?

options.text: Objects of mixed data types can be stored
Elements in an array cannot be sorted
Index of first element of an array is 1
Easier to store elements of same data type

questions.explanation: Arrays store elements of the same data type and present in continuous memory locations.

questions.questionText: What are the disadvantages of arrays?

options.text: Data structure like queue or stack cannot be implemented
There are chances of wastage of memory space if elements inserted in an array are lesser than the allocated size
Index value of an array can be negative

questions.explanation: Arrays are of fixed size. If we insert elements less than the allocated size, unoccupied positions canâ€™t be used again. Wastage will occur in memory.

questions.questionText: Assuming int is of 4bytes, what is the size of int arr[15];?
questions.explanation: Since there are 15 int elements and each int is of 4bytes, we get 15*4 = 60bytes.

questions.questionText: In general, the index of the first element in an array is __________
questions.explanation: In general, Array Indexing starts from 0. Thus, the index of the first element in an array is 0.
